timeline.title: QIF Framework v1.0 Published
timeline.description: 71 attack techniques across 11 tactics and 7 domains. Full threat registry with TARA technique IDs.

timeline.title: NSP Protocol Specification Released
timeline.description: Post-quantum neural security protocol. Under 4% implant power budget. Wire-level encryption for BCI data streams.

timeline.title: TARA Atlas Published
timeline.description: Dual-use atlas mapping 71 attack techniques to therapeutic analogs. 60% of attack mechanisms have clinical counterparts.

timeline.title: NISS v1.0 Specification Complete
timeline.description: First CVSS v4.0 extension for neural interfaces. Five metrics: Biological Impact, Cognitive Integrity, Consent Violation, Reversibility, Neuroplasticity.

timeline.title: 71 CVSS v4.0 Base Vector Mappings Complete
timeline.description: Every technique in the QIF threat registry mapped to a CVSS v4.0 base vector with companion NISS extension vector.

timeline.title: First BCI Software PoC Exploit
timeline.description: Three-phase exploit chain against a widely-used BCI data streaming library. Responsible disclosure in progress.

timeline.title: NISS Submitted to FIRST.org CVSS SIG
timeline.description: Formal proposal sent to cvss@first.org for NISS registration as a CVSS v4.0 extension under Section 3.11 of the User Guide.

timeline.title: First CVE Filed via TARA Framework
timeline.description: CWE-862 (Missing Authorization) on RealTek HD Audio codec jack retasking. 9-year-old unfiled vulnerability found through systematic gap analysis. Disclosed to TWCERT/CC, RealTek, and MITRE.

timeline.title: Consumer Sensor Exploitation Domain Added
timeline.description: New 8th domain (S) with 4 tactics and 8 initial techniques covering upstream consumer device attacks. Later expanded to 28 S-domain techniques (99 total).

timeline.title: S-Domain Expanded to 28 Techniques (T0080â€“T0099)
timeline.description: 20 new consumer sensor techniques across audio, optical, IMU, RF, thermal, and biometric categories. 5 chain techniques document multi-stage escalation paths. Registry reaches 99 techniques.

timeline.title: DSM-5-TR Neural Impact Chain Mapping
timeline.description: First-ever mapping from BCI security severity to psychiatric diagnosis. All techniques mapped to DSM-5-TR diagnostic clusters via the Neural Impact Chain. See the whitepaper v6 or TARA changelog for details.

timeline.title: Registry Crosses 100 Techniques
timeline.description: 4 new consumer device side-channel techniques (T0100–T0103): neural steganographic encoding, multi-modal keystroke inference, screen photometry sensing, and WiFi CSI respiratory inference. All confirmed dual-use with clinical applications.
